content:
Specific Surface Areas and Pore Volumes of MIL-53 Materials material S BET (m2·g–1) S BET (m2·cc–1) V p,micro (cm3·g–1) activation conditions MIL-53(Al) 1706 ± 102 1600 ± 30 0.60 ± 0.01 523–623 K for 24 h in vacuum MIL-53(Cr) 1690 ± 82 1745 ± 85 0.61 ± 0.02 553–623 K in air for 24 h MIL-53(Ga) 1120 ± 55 1213 ± 60 0.40 ± 0.04 553–623 K in air for 24 h MIL-53(Fe) NA NA NA 398 K in air for 12 h MIL-53(Sc) NA NA NA 623 K in air for 12 h

MIL-53 samples were outgassed at 573 K overnight before nitrogen adsorption–desorption measurements. MIL-53­(Ga) was outgassed at a lower temperature, 473 K, for 12 h first, followed by a quick heating to 593 K for 5 h before cooling down.

Calculated in pressure ranges individually determined as proposed by Snurr et al.

Derived by the t-plot method.
clean_text:
Table 1. Specific Surface Areas and Pore Volumes of MIL-53 Materials

| material   | S<sub>BET</sub> (m<sup>2</sup>·g<sup>–1</sup>) | S<sub>BET</sub> (m<sup>2</sup>·cc<sup>–1</sup>) | V<sub>p,micro</sub> (cm<sup>3</sup>·g<sup>–1</sup>) | activation conditions          |
|------------|---------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| MIL-53(Al) | 1706 ± 102                                  | 1600 ± 30                                      | 0.60 ± 0.01                                      | 523–623 K for 24 h in vacuum     |
| MIL-53(Cr) | 1690 ± 82                                   | 1745 ± 85                                      | 0.61 ± 0.02                                      | 553–623 K in air for 24 h        |
| MIL-53(Ga) | 1120 ± 55                                   | 1213 ± 60                                      | 0.40 ± 0.04                                      | 553–623 K in air for 24 h        |
| MIL-53(Fe) | NA                                          | NA                                             | NA                                              | 398 K in air for 12 h            |
| MIL-53(Sc) | NA                                          | NA                                             | NA                                              | 623 K in air for 12 h            |

a MIL-53 samples were outgassed at 573 K overnight before nitrogen adsorption–desorption measurements. MIL-53­(Ga) was outgassed at a lower temperature, 473 K, for 12 h first, followed by a quick heating to 593 K for 5 h before cooling down.
b Calculated in pressure ranges individually determined as proposed by Snurr et al.
c Derived by the t-plot method.
